name: Chocolate Coated Cherries (Fondant)
author: Shirley Drury
instructions: In a 2 quart saucepan, combine sugar, water and corn syrup cook to 238 to 240°. Stir mixture at the beginning of cooking to be sure the sugar is dissolved before reaching the boiling point. When mixture has cooked to 238 or 240° remove from heat and point to cool. It can be poured on a marble surface, cookie tin or shallow pan, porcelain topped table, or a large platter. Let stand until lukewarm in center of batch and cool at the outside edges.
